meanings.definition: An introductory section of a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The proem of the story set the stage for the exciting adventure ahead.
meanings.sent2: The author included a proem at the beginning of the book to provide background information.
meanings.sent3: The proem was like a welcoming handshake from the author to the readers.
meanings.sent4: Her proem was a key that unlocked the mysteries hidden within the pages.
meanings.sent5: The proem painted a vivid picture of the story's setting and characters.

meanings.definition: To introduce or preface a work with a proem.
meanings.sent1: She decided to proem her essay with a personal anecdote to engage the readers.
meanings.sent2: The poet always proems his poems with lines that capture the essence of his work.
meanings.sent3: He proemed his speech with a joke to lighten the mood in the room.
meanings.sent4: The speaker proemed his lecture with a quote from a famous philosopher.
meanings.sent5: To proem a story is to invite the audience into a world of imagination and wonder.
